metadata.title: CVE-2022-48541 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in ImageMagick 7.0.10-45 and 6.9.11-22 allows remoteattackers to perform a denial of service via the "identify -help" command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm6').
